page.title: 12THE WANDERING DEER
page.content: In the nothern part of our Domesday area there are quite a number of woods and larger deciduous plantations.These do not form a large continuous tract of woodland but are more like small islands in a sea of grassland. In these woods live roe deer.They are completely free and do not belong to anyone nor do they stay on any one farmers land .They move openly across the farmland to reach another plantation where they feed and find shelter. There is no attempt to hunt these creatures,neither do the landowners try to keep their numbers regulated.It seems that nature does this by itself for there is not enough woodland to support a very large herd.No-one is very sure how many there are in the herds but one farmer thought their numbers reached about 30 in this area.
